title: Compiler unnecessary panicked due to a mistake in where clause

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The compiler unexpectedly panicked where a nice error should be produced.

I tried this code:
    
    pub fn zip<K, V, W, A, B>(a: A, b: B)
        where K: Ord,
              A: Iterator<Item=(K, V)>,
              A: Iterator<Item=(K, W)>,
    {
    
    }

I simply forgot to change the third entry in the where clause to `B`.

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.17.0-nightly (24a70eb59 2017-02-09)

LLVM version: 3.9
